newsitem.title: UK: European VGO stronger on European demand.
newsitem.headline: European VGO stronger on European demand.

text.p: European vaccum gas oil prices rose by the end of the week on stronger European demand with little supply seen, but the trans-Atlantic arb was virtually shut, traders said.

They said that low sulphur VGO cargoes were assessed in the $127/$129 region after a trade in the past two days at $129.90 fob for a 20-25,000 tonne cargo loading July 18-23 sold by a major to a Spanish refiner.
A cargo traded earlier this week at $124 fob and trders said three other European buyers were heard on the market.
"On the VGO front, there is still European demand. We have seen a couple of deals this week. There's buying interest still from three players," one trader said.
"I think the market is fairly tight now, there's not too much avails around".
But traders said that the arbitrage to the United States was not workable at the moment.
"The arb to the States is shut...The only way to make it work is if you discounted the backwardation...but I very much doubt it can be done," a trader said.
High sulphur VGO cargoes were largely quiet during the weak except for a small parcel sold at around $130 cif. --Haitham Haddadin, London newsroom, +44 171 542 8145
